page.title: 06THE POST ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S
page.content: Living on a remote island means the postal service will be different.For example on some days the local residents collect their mail from the island sub-post office and on others the local post lady delivers it.Also there is only one collection a day from the only postbox on the island. The time of collection is governed by the arrival of the launch,and her schedule is affected by tide conditions.In the summer there are six mails in and out per week.This winter we got five mails in and five out which is more than previous winters because of the newly introduced sky bus service to the main island of St.Marys.The local post mistress hand cancels stamps with a hand stamp and then sorts the mail into St.Marys and Penzance bags.These are then taken to the quay by van and put on a launch.
